Review Title: be sure to have a backup, because it's not reliable.
Review Text:
[update]: reminder - they only expect it to work for a year, since the warranty is only 12 months.

after 2 years of ownership:

it died in year one (9 months) from new (unresponsive, blue light only). I had to ship it back, it was replaced. dealing with support to get an RMA was relatively easy. I was without a camera for about 2 weeks from failure, contact, ship to them, inspect, return shipping.

it died again, in year two (14 months after first replacement). support has been _significantly worse_ to work with so far. after 10 days of excessive hassle dealing with support, they.....declared it out of warranty.

Clever little thing! I love the true physical PTZ and the very high quality image of this little webcam. Good low-light performance too, since the lens & sensor are so good: low-light image doesn‚Äôt get all grainy, and the camera automatically increases or decreases the exposure level to adapt. (I believe it does this digitally: I don‚Äôt see the aperture changing in the physical lens when it happens)

This is the one that screws to a tripod bolt (standard thread & size) or clips to the top of your monitor‚Äî this is NOT the InstaLink360 that goes on the end of a selfie stick. No battery in this one, no onboard data card, it must plug into your phone or laptop‚Äî but in that role, damn is it good.

InstaLink does provide control software for it, but I haven‚Äôt had to download it yet: the AI-interpreted hand signals work fine for my purposes.

My daughter purchased this for me, as I am a volunteer tutor who aids adults to pass their GED on line via my computer.  Even though it stopped working,  their tech representatives made it ease to send back at no charge and no quibble repairs made.  It‚Äôs a great camera that you can also use a whiteboard for presentations to students.  Buy this, you won‚Äôt be disappointed!
Terrible company and terrible product. Company pushed an ota update that bricked the device and wants $120 to fix it
If you need this to work flawlessly, it won't

Review Title: Great for groups and as a webcam
Review Text: Super impressive. I use it for group meetings where I can manually trigger a saved spot in the room depending on who is speaking. Works great as a regular webcam with a nice big sensor. Price seems worth it for the tech. I put it on top of a selfie pole with a stand as it is light enough to not need a full tripod.

This camera is extremly good.  It comes with a ton of features like face tracking and different modes for various need cases, including desktop display (showing something on your desk, not the computer desktop).  It folds up when not being used, so the lens is basically closed, and it has a green light around the base when active.  There are a lot of reviews online that go into detail, check them out if you really want a deep dive, but for my money, this is the best value short of a DSLR.

Review Title: Wont work after a couple months.
Review Text: Camera is great when it works. Now it wont connect to my desktop and it wont download the updated driver. Tried it on my laptop and it work for about 2 weeks and now, again it wont connect to either of my computers.

Review Title: Not worth the trouble. Terrible Software & Customer Service.
Review Text: Great product but the software is terrible, rarely works, and the customer service is the worst I have seen.

Review Title: Unreliable and frequently fails to connect
Review Text: This camera is incredibly fussy about whether it will connect audio and video for Teams and Zoom calls.  In may instances it will be working and then turn itself off the minute I make a Teams call.  Answering a Teams call it may work if I have time to unplug it and then plug it back in before the call goes to VM.  The problem is so bad that work colleagues are insisting that I ditch this camera.  It's going in the trash can and I'm buying something else.  On the positive side, when it did decide to connect it worked  great in terms of tracking and the image quality was very good.
This camera is great! I use it almost daily and has great quality. I love the face tracking and that I can configure it to my stream deck.

Review Title: Does the job as a webcam!
Review Text: simply LOVE this little guy. keep thinking its a little robot but its not. im a fan of gadgets so as soon as i saw this thing online it intrigued me. it does the trick as a webcam for sure. great quality but i dont think i have a powerful enough machine to get all of the full experience out of it because it can do A LOT. the tracking feature is fun and helps out when filming or showing off stuff on camera. lol. Takes a loot of experimentation to understand just how it all works but thats half the fun i find in these type of gadgets and tech things!? lol. its very fun for what it is.¬†

Review Title: It doesn't work with Apple's FaceTime software
Review Text: The product description says this webcam is compatible with Mac OS.  It also says that the webcam is "Fully compatible with Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Google Meet, and more."  Since all Macs are pre-loaded with FaceTime webchat software, you might assume from InstaLink's ads that, since the product is compatible with Mac OS, the camera just HAS TO be compatible with FaceTime.  (Remember the "and more" part of ". . . Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Google Meet, and more"?)  But if you assume this, you will be wrong.  I do note that the webcam works flawlessly on the Zoom platform.  But it is NOT compatible with FaceTime.  While the image your FaceTime chat buddy will get of you will be a nice one (but I did notice occasional image freezes during a typical chat session), the audio quality will not be acceptable.  The voice you transmit will be full of echo and other artifacts.  When the person you are calling tries to reply to you, he will hear his own voice in a slight delay.  Adjusting your audio output will not solve the problem.  According to InstaLink's technical support, "Our team has confirmed that the Link 2 and Link 2C do not have built-in echo cancellation algorithms. Instead, they rely on the echo cancellation capabilities of the software being used, such as FaceTime."  What this means is that unless you wear headphones while you chat, do not use FaceTime with this product.  Use Zoom.
pricey but worty. Best webcam I have so far
Great value-product

Getting it set up with the controller was so complex and then I didn't have a way to set it up with streaming on twitch or anything. Also when using the controller to record and take pics I can't find where that stuff went. The tracking is pretty good still has some sensitivity to work on but the tracking is still pretty good and the camera quality i love so while it has good features its just to complex to get working right its not a simple plug and use camera.

Review Text:

For Linux users, there is no "official" app, but you can control it from OBS or using a free app called "WebCamControl" and available as a FlatPak.

Review Title: It's better than all the others in the price range. Better than the Elgato Facecam Mk2.
Review Text:
For the price, you just can't beat it. I've only had it for one day, but I've put it through the paces and it's a tiny little beast. Picture quality is really great, even at 1080p60fps. It's damn near it's 2160p30fps quality. Almost can't tell the difference.
The auto AI face tracking is very well done.
I'll say it again, you can't beat this thing in this price range. I tried a couple others in the sub $130 price ranges, and they just didn't cut it. This is better than the Elgato Facecam Mk.2. Just get this one and be happy with your purchase.

I bought this for the picture quality, which is great, but the camera does not work with Teams and constantly loses connection in Zoom.  I would stay away from the product.  Even there customer service lost connection when I tried to contact them.
The tripod only raises the camera 7.5 inches which is not high enough to be above the screen height of my laptop so I have to put it on top of some books to be high enough.

Review Text: It works perfectly well. Installation is super easy

Review Title: This is the webcam to get
Review Text: I bought this webcam to use in making videos for YouTube.  The camera is well designed and well made. It has been flawless in setting up and in using. It takes video to a whole new level over a MacBook Pro webcam. The software works well for fine tuning if desired. I highly recommend this webcam. Buy it, you won‚Äôt regret it.

Review Title: Great quality, low distortion, sharp clear picture
Review Text:
I‚Äôm genuinely blown away by how good this camera is. From the high-quality construction to the crystal-clear video, it exceeded my expectations.
Here‚Äôs a quick breakdown:
Build Quality: Excellent ‚Äî solid, premium feel
Image Quality: Exceptional ‚Äî sharp, clear, bright
Image Distortion: This is where it really stands out. Most people don‚Äôt realize that the ultra-wide angles on typical webcams tend to distort the mid-face, pulling it forward and making people look odd on video calls. This camera strikes the perfect balance: wide enough to capture a full frame, but not so wide that it distorts your face. In short, you actually look like you on this camera ‚Äî more natural and accurate than others I‚Äôve tried.

I‚Äôm very pleasantly surprised and highly impressed.

Review Title: Great for dedicated streaming or people who wanna look their best in zoom meetings
Review Text: I‚Äôve been using this webcam for streaming and will soon be using it for zoom, and the ai tracking features are so helpful for keeping me in frame. It is 4k quality as advertised, and all you have to do to connect is plug and play. Easy 5 out of 5 here.
Buena imagen

Review Title: Great picture and good audio quality so far...
Review Text: I have had about a half dozen different web cams before. Some expensive, some much less.  I've only had 2 video calls with it so far and the picture clarity is super good.  Didn't have any issues with the mic. The auto track is good but sometimes adjusts to frequently.  It seems I move a bit while on calls.  lol. Fortunately I can turn off the auto track. Sp far, it is a 5 star for me.
Muy buena

La calidad es muy buena, el audio tiene retorno permanente y no funciona correctamente, estoy pensando en regresarla

UPDATE
I encountered a small issue that required a refund, I was very impressed by the way the customer experience team handled the situation. The support was fast, clear, and respectful, which made me feel valued as a customer.
What I appreciate most is how smooth the communication was ‚Äî every message was professional yet warm. This kind of service gives me full confidence to buy again in the future. I‚Äôm very satisfied with the attention I received and I look forward to exploring more Insta360 products soon.

I work remotely and find that high quality conferencing equipment is worth it, but I've been putting off getting a better webcam since big review sites claim that there's not basically no difference between high-end equipment and the standard Logitech C922. Well, they're wrong and this is drastically better. I typically work in a reasonably bright room but with no direct light on my face, and the C922 would leave my face in shadow. I bought this camera and a ring light, but it turns out the ring light is unnecessary: I look completely normal and unshadowed on the InstaLink even without the ring light.

Wish I had bought something like this years ago.

Review Title: Very functional camera for the price
Review Text: This is a very functional camera. We like the green screen capability and you can import your own background too.

Too many issues. Colors look washed out, and the virtual camera constantly fails‚Äîoften showing a black screen instead of the feed. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn‚Äôt. This feels very much like a software problem, and far from ‚Äúready to go.‚Äù

As someone who‚Äôs been on a Mac for over 10 years, repeatedly uninstalling/reinstalling the software brought back memories of my old Windows troubleshooting days.

There‚Äôs also an incredibly frustrating lag when recording 4K video. It got so bad that I now have to fix the timing in my editing software because nothing I tried could remove the lag.

The best thing about this camera is the magnetic mount‚Äîit sits securely on top of my monitor‚Äîand the resolution can look good. But for a $150 camera with all the hype, I expected much more: a frictionless, plug-and-play experience, not hours wasted each week trying to get the virtual camera working (which is the only way to enable blurry background or bokeh effects).

I‚Äôm returning this and will be looking at competitor products instead.

Review Title: Great webcam for professionals and live streaming
Review Text:
Great webcam, really good camera and image quality, appreciate the privacy feature of closing the camera cover (one of my buying pain points), it‚Äôs autofocus and following feature is CRAZY!

The base is okay, it all depends on the thickness of your monitor‚Äôs border, but yiu can use a selfie stick with a base or a tripod to mount it on that and works.

It‚Äôs a great value for the money because it also brings its own software where you customize the lighting, the limits of what people will see and you can adjust throughout your calls, a great function that physically can‚Äôt be seen, but for sure it ups the product‚Äôs value.
I love this camera.  It is so small and easy to set-up.  The app is intuitive!!  I love it, so does my producer.

Beats my Logitech c930e by a mile. Motion is smoother, picture is a bit sharper and has less noise in it in low to medium lighting, it has a more versatile mount, more features, and even the mic is better. I don‚Äôt use the software much but it‚Äôs user friendly, also.

Only minor complaint is that the included cable is a bit short for my setup. I ended buying a longer cable for it so I had more freedom with where to place it.

For the price? This is the one.
Nice camera, but too heavy and bulky for a macbook pro. Kept tilting my screen back.

I tested five other cameras on top of this one, and NONE of them could even come close. The picture quality is outstanding and jam-packed with features that I'll never even use. If you want a webconferencing camera and are willing to pay more for it, this is the one you need. Don't even bother looking elsewhere - get this one. You won't regret it.

I debated between this and the Logitech Brio 4k.  They were the same cost but this one came out better for video quality and the ai tracking.  I should have gone with my gut and got the trusted Logitech cam vs this one.  Out of the box you are instructed to scan the QR code for setup - that produced nothing.  I went to their website and downloaded the software.  It was straightforward and seemed to work well until I went to update the default camera in Zoom and Teams.  OMG - 3 restarts, lowered the quality all the way down to 720 - still was making my high quality pc freeze.  Also I was disappointed this does not have the VOF adjustment that Logitech does.  I have spent hours messing with this but ultimately just filed for a return and ordered the Logitech camera.  Logitech may not have all the whistles and bells this camera has but at least it won't crash my computer.

Review Title: Doesn't work with ARM64 PCs but Awesome Customer Service
Review Text:
The camera doesn't really work with ARM64 PCs. In addition, it only fully work with PCs (not sure about Macs) with Nvidia graphic cards. When I installed the software, my internal and Insta360 stopped working. I ended up removing Insta360 software to get internal webcam working. I bought the webcam for the features of listed when compared to other webcams. I didn't see the limitations of the webcam listed with the features. I definitely will not buy this webcam again. For me, this is a paperweight until Insta360 updated the software and possibly firmware of the webcam.

Update 7/16/2025:

The company reached out to me confirming that the camera currently doesn't work with Windows ARM64 devices AND offered me a partial refund. I still love the features of the webcam. I'm anxiously awaiting the (hoping) it'll be updated to work with ARM64 devices, especially since all Macs use ARM64. I'm very impressed by the customer service and increased from 2 stars to 4 stars. I'll give 5 stars when the webcam works with Windows ARM64 devices. I highly recommend now for devices with Nvidia graphics. Hopefully, soon I can highly recommend for all devices.

[[VIDEOID:157b0f088c02494e6d66661ed85cf4e8]] The Insta360 Link 2 arrived defective, powering on, spinning, showing a red light, and failing. Over a week of technical support, including sending logs and videos, led to no resolution. Support was chaotic, with reps ignoring case history and asking me to do redundant steps already done and noted in the case history. Clearly they don‚Äôt read before firing off instructions. The lack of coordination and professionalism was poor. Learning their ‚ÄúAmerican Headquarters‚Äù is a shared workspace desk in Irvine, CA, further eroded trust. The product and support are utterly disappointing.

Review Title: Software not working, poor response from support
Review Text:
Returning. Most-recent software on my Windows 10 machine hung on "Are you willing to assist us in improving the user experience?" dialog box, and neither the Disagree or Agree buttons worked to clear the box. Repeatedly reinstalled and restarted, no change.

Called customer support, and the rep asked me to email a screenshot and promised a 24-hour turnaround for a solution, most likely sooner. It's day three with no response, and I need a camera for work, so it's going back.

Review Title: Insta360 Link 2: The Ultimate Web Cam
Review Text:
The Insta360 Link 2 is an incredible device. I bought this even though my Apple Studio Display has a built-in Web Cam; however the video quality is subpar. Another reason is that I use a BenQ Halo monitor lamp that covers the camera.

FYI, I had to purchase the device in the link to mount it on the BenQ Halo. However, it‚Äôs not needed if you don‚Äôt use a monitor lamp. BenQ‚Äôs proprietary Webcam mount is out of stock with no date of re-stock.

https://www.amazon.com/JCWINY-Accessory-ScreenBar-Adjustable-Computer/dp/B0CQFSVW7N

Back to the Insta360 Link 2. Setup is easy and straight forward. Great functionality. The size is appropriate for a Web Cam of this type with powered mechanisms inside. However, it's not overtly huge.

The tracking feature is nice with three (3) levels of speed. However, most will remain seated in one position; but it will compensate for slight movements. Auto focus is great to keep you looking pristine.

4K video can introduce a bit of video noise for objects in the background. It can be lessened by reducing the frames per second down from 30fps to 25fps or 24fps. 1080p video is the sweet spot.

Upon starting your computer, it will go through a calibration sequence of about 5 seconds with no video. A privacy lens is not needed when the camera is not in use as it returns to a downward facing position. Background choices are nice when your room is a bit unsightly; or you‚Äôd rather not have your audience know you‚Äôre in the bedroom or another area you‚Äôd rather not reveal.

FYI, on my Mac Mini M4 I had to go into settings and activate ‚Äúcamera extensions‚Äù to use backgrounds as they are unavailable upon Initial install of the software. 24/7 tech support guided me through the activation process which I contacted at 1AM CST. Another great reason to purchase the Insta360 Link 2.

The Insta360 Link 2 is sightly expensive at $199_USD. However, if you‚Äôre looking for a Web Cam w

Review Title: Insta360 Link 2: The Ultimate Web Cam
Review Text: ith great video and audio (other features aside) you won‚Äôt be disappointed. I highly recommend this product. In fact, I ordered a second one for my other Apple Studio Display.

For the price, this is a great webcam - by far the best I've used for video quality and color accuracy. No issues using with OBS Studio. I don't know about the microphone quality as I use a Rode Procaster and wireless lapel mics. I also have a Razor Kiyo Pro I use with my Elgato Prompter, but this Link 2 is nicer quality to my eye and has FAR better software. This is no replacement for a mirrorless or DSLR, but it is good for a professional looking meeting, especially when paired with something like an Elgato Key Light Mini or two.

Review Title: Plug and Play with no issues on MacOS
Review Text:
Was simply plug and play with no drivers or software required on a 2021 MacBook Pro running Sequoia 15.3.2 including the AI tracking. While not required I did install the desktop software in order to update the firmware and had no problems there either. Firmware update was just a couple clicks in the Insta360 Link Controller software with no issues what so ever. I don't doubt the reviews that claim they had issues are legit but I can say these issues do not exist on MacOS Sequoia when starting with a camera running firmware that is shipping as of May of 2025 and OBS for software.

Video quality is as advertised and much better than the built in apple webcams (not that that sets the bar very high). The audio has some echo/reverb to it despite having acoustic treatments in the room. I will stick with my Shure SM7B for audio. The fit and finish of the camera feels high quality.

I have only been using the camera for one day so cant say I wont bump into issues with extended use but first impressions are good. I can ignore the audio quality since I had no intention of using the built in microphone.

Review Title: Great camera. Less than optimal software.
Review Text: Excellent camera. Software on desktop is glitchy with clunky UI. But camera itself is awesome! Hopefully they improve the software soon.

Excellent webcam. Autofocus is good, color accuracy is fine, durability is great, mountability is really good for a webcam. I streamed an entire cross country road trip with it, I currently use it as the main cam for my backyard bunny and birds streams, and it's a decent alternate view camera when I'm gaming. I've used Streamer.bot and Move Value Plugin in OBS to allow my Twitch chat to move the camera with their channel points. They can always check in on the cats whenever they want now. Connectivity is instant and the software is really decent. I finally used the DeskView function to stream fixing my GPU. It worked great. I would highly recommend this camera and am hopeful they hear our pleas to update the software so we can use multiple cameras with it. It's a niche thing that few people are going to want but those of us that do REALLY want that ability. Oh lastly it's SUPER durable. I have it mounted to a suction cup quarter inch mount on a window and the cats have knocked it off of there serval times already dropping it about 5 feet each time. It's held up like a champ. I looked at a ton of reviews between this and the Obsbot Tiny 2 and this just wins overall. Sure Obsbot has more filters but honestly they kind of suck. Just use 3rd party stuff for filters. I've had this thing since November 2024 and it's been awesome. I'd genuinely love to buy more of them and just get rid of my crappy Logitech cams altogether but much like Logitech there's still no support for multiples of the same model in the software. Would love to save some money and buy more if this camera but so far it's looking like I might have to step up to a big boy POE PTZ setup for multiple PTZ cameras. Still don't regret buying this thing. It's the perfect middle ground between webcam & actual surveillance PTZ cams.
excelente
Great AI tracking cam for Mac with a lot of features. Excellent easy-to-use software.

Review Title: Received Defective Unit but after a month, they've made it right.
Review Text:
The saga of my new webcam has a happy ending. Recommended by Wirecutter, I was very excited about the webcam and I bought the Link2 on April 14th. By April 29th--after 1 usage, I was trying to determine with the service chat folks why my webcam was malfunctioning. On May 13th, I went it in for repair. On May 29th, I was told it was shipped back after they replaced the motherboard of the webcam. To date, I have still not received the webcam and the tracking # hasn't moved from its point of origin. The repair department has had my webcam longer than I have and it should have been replaced rather than repaired as it was defective when I bought it. The only good thing I can say is that while a long tedious process, the back and forth between their chat technicians was polite. But all I want is a working webcam. If I ever get it back, I'll update its ability to function.
UPDATE: Despite noting on the service ticket that they had replaced the motherboard, I'm happy to report that they sent me an entirely new working webcam. Additionally, their customer service followed up with me to ensure it was working. I've changed my rating and can now say that I'm a satisfied customer. I've changed my rating from 1 to 4 stars.
Great picture/video quality, but it creates a microphone delay.

I have already recommended this product to all my colleagues. The quality is amazing and I get asked about it all the time. I work for a software company and spend all day in zoom calls so this was a must.

This thing has been a gamechanger for me at work. So much so that one of our C-level execs saw it in action and ordered them for his whole staff.
If you have a lot of Teams/Zoom calls where you're working with diagrams, being able to just walk to your physical whiteboard without any fiddling or setup is GREAT. The snap-to-area around the whiteboard actually works great without having to even interact with the controller app. But the smart whiteboard setting also works exactly as advertised. My whiteboard is across the room at a 90-degree angle to my PC, and it fixes the angle skew just like in the advertisement video. Even if you don't have a whiteboard, the desk view is actually good enough that you can just use a paper notepad and pen. Its so convenient to just hit one button for the desk view and grab a pen/paper on a Teams/Zoom call.
Its been a while since I've been so happy with a tech purchase, but this one literally makes my life better every day.
Stopped working in less than a week. Customer service website it barely useable. The process to send it back for repair is slow. For what I paid for this, I would hope for better quality control.
Amazing quality. Very versatile for my needs

It randomly vibrates and makes a buzzing sounds, causing the image to get blurry. I have only had for 2 months and have never used it. Only test it , I can‚Äôt imagine if try to stream with it

I think it‚Äôs a little over priced

Review Title: Hilariously Smart...and a Little Too Observant
Review Text:
The InstaLink 360 is a fantastic little gadget‚Äîcrisp video, smooth tracking, and a magical ability to make you look like a professional speaker in every meeting with zero effort. It‚Äôs basically my new favorite coworker.

That said‚Ä¶ we need to talk about the hand gesture feature. As an Italian, I now live in fear that every expressive hand movement is triggering a full-blown cinematic tracking shot. I was explaining something with my usual flair, and the camera went rogue‚Äîzoomed in dramatically on the whiteboard, then whipped around and locked onto my dog like she was giving a TED Talk.

It‚Äôs like having an overenthusiastic film student filming a spaghetti western: intense close-ups, spontaneous pans, and all the drama.

Still, five stars. Just don‚Äôt blame the camera when your next Zoom turns into a Scorsese film. Mangia and motion at your own risk. üçùüé•

Review Title: Picture quality 100% but realignment makes it annoying
Review Text: The picture quality is too notch but the negative is that the camera keeps resetting after use and I have to keep realigning it before a new use. Yes I turn off Ai tracking and tried with it on as I want my background to my right to be caught

I‚Äôve bought a couple of these now, one for me, one for a client and they‚Äôve both delivered exactly what we needed.

The image quality is top-tier for a webcam. That 1/2" sensor and HDR setup gets you really close to DSLR-level video without the setup headache. It‚Äôs not quite DSLR, but it‚Äôs the closest thing I‚Äôve seen in this category.

AI tracking is smooth, audio‚Äôs crystal clear even in noisy spaces, and the autofocus just works. No lag, no blur. Plus, gesture controls and remote smartphone access? Total game-changer when you're presenting or producing on the fly.

If you need a webcam that looks pro, sounds sharp, and feels built for modern streaming and calls and content creation, this is the one I keep recommending.

This camera is pretty sick. The only thing I wish is that they could make it so you could stream at the same quality on OBS as when you use it as a WebCam, I find it strange to be honest that the quality change is based on how you‚Äôre using it but whatever it‚Äôs still pretty nice and it‚Äôs pretty clean and it‚Äôs pretty smooth when it comes to it following you with it AI feature if it‚Äôs actually AI I don‚Äôt know but it‚Äôs cool

Review Title: Camera is on & facing me when I did not turn it on.

Review Title: Too many issues with Teams and USB Hub usage.
Review Text: This has all sorts of connection issues and doesn't get recognized by Microsoft Teams unless you use the one USB c port on your laptop. It doesn't have proper driver support to work well through USB and if you need multiple peripherals for your laptop or PC and have to use a usb hub this is pretty much worthless. Im sure it works well for all the streamers and their OBS software, but for work computers it's a definite NO GO.

Review Title: Great camera quality, slightly annoying AI
Review Text:
I bought this because I wanted something better than my laptop webcam, and the quality is definitely there. The picture is super clear and I love the lighting adjustments, background filter, and how you can move the camera angle through the app. That part feels really modern and works well.

That said, the instructions aren‚Äôt super beginner-friendly and some things took trial and error to figure out. The AI tracking doesn‚Äôt follow me smoothly if I move too far to the side, and it turns itself back on way too easily if I adjust the camera manually. The mic sounds really good if you‚Äôre sitting near your setup, but not great for moving around.

Overall solid webcam with great features, just takes some getting used to.

Review Title: Bummer of a camera so far.
Review Text: [[VIDEOID:d1542d8712ce718d7eea1b36a842b032]] Lots of lagging with this camera about 20 minutes into my Zoom broadcast, I run online exercise classes. Video lags behind the live audio about 20 minutes in. I tried using my iPhone as webcam via Zoom and did not have the same issues. I bought another competitor's cam and will try that this week. Chatted with tech Insta360 support but haven't heard back as promised. Bummer. All this being said, it's possible that this isn't a camera issue and something else with my MacBook. But I've reinstalled the operating system and still experienced same. I think it's the camera. If I determine it's not the camera, I will delete this review. Posting review on 7/11/25
This thing is near DSLR levels in image quality, great performance in low light. Much better than my brio

Review Title: I hope I haven't wasted my time and money on this
Review Text:
Disappointed ‚Äî Feels Like a Beta Product, Not Ready for Prime Time

I‚Äôve had the Insta360 Link2 for about three weeks now, and unfortunately, I‚Äôm frustrated with the experience.

I bought it primarily for the AI tracking feature ‚Äî the idea of staying centered on video calls sounded great. After some research, the Link2 seemed like the best choice. But in practice, it falls short. For starters, I can‚Äôt use Microsoft Teams and the Link Controller app at the same time. This means I have no way to control the camera once I‚Äôm in a Teams call ‚Äî a huge limitation.

When I do have the Controller app open, I try to focus the camera on me, maybe even ‚Äútrain‚Äù the AI to recognize my face. But after about a minute, the AI gets distracted and starts tracking my wall clock instead. I've contacted support and hope they can help, but so far, the tracking has been unreliable at best. If this isn‚Äôt resolved, I‚Äôll have to turn tracking off entirely and position the camera manually ‚Äî which defeats the purpose of buying this model.

The hand gesture controls are a neat idea, but they rarely work. I‚Äôve uninstalled and reinstalled the software, updated everything (software and firmware), and still no luck.

Occasionally, when I plug in the camera, the image appears flipped upside down. The only fix is manually toggling the Horizontal Correction tab.

Bottom line: the Insta360 Link2 feels more like a beta release than a finished product. There‚Äôs potential here, but it‚Äôs not ready for dependable, everyday use ‚Äî especially for professionals relying on consistent performance in video calls.

Review Title: FINALLY a webcamera that is worth buying
Review Text: FINALLY. A webcam that is (almost) what we are looking for. Every other webcam I purchased I sent back because they all suffer the same problems. Absudly wide angle of view, poor picture quaality, digital (only) zoom. Why can't we have a quality camera for a webcam? This camera however is close to what we need and vertainly good enough. It is 4k with digital zoom but this time, cropping the image in (to counter the unnecessary wide angle) does NOT make the picture blurry. The colors from the sensor are good. The AI works (although unnecessary). Finally a webcamera that is worth buying. Finally!

Sumamente satisfecho, cumple con mis expectativas, el sensor de seguimiento con IA es muy preciso, el autoenfoque es r√°pido y eficaz. Algo que aclarar es que no esperen la calidad de video de una c√°mara profesional, tiene una buena calidad, pero al final es una webcam. Si quieren grabar videos o hacer stream y verse como los grandes, lo mejor es adquirir una c√°mara profesional, pero para iniciar y para crear contenido est√° c√°mara es la ideal.

El producto lleg√≥ en excelentes condiciones, lo volver√≠a a comprar.

While this camera seems to be ok so far and is FAR superior to the HyperX Vision S, the image quality is middling.

Pros:
*The autofocus speed is decent. It will take longer than you expect to focus on another object.

*USB C connectivity is there and you're not limited to a permanent cord.

*There is a shutter cover.

*No issues with Teams or WebEx (though you are limited to 1080p).

Cons:
It heats up quickly. Heat kills. In a small package without vents or heatsinks, it will degrade the components in short order. I'd recommend an extended warranty.

The magnetic connection to its mount is not useful to me, as I use it connected to a tripod or solid mount and the possibility of it detaching and falling to the floor is high.

The microphone sound quality is poor, but I use an external microphone for most things.

My use case is 50% meetings and 50% recording a monitor / display that I am working on. The image quality when it's pointed at a screen is poor, no matter how far away or how well lit the area.

If you just need a new webcam, it seems ok for $100. Above that, I'd consider other, newer options, as image quality might have improved.
